problem:
What is an organizer and how does it influence develop-ment ?

A. An organizer is an external environmental factor that affects the embryo's development by altering gene expression

B. An organizer is a type of cell that forms the basis of the embryo

C. An organizer is a group of stem cells that can differentiate into any tissue type during development

D. An organizer is a genetic code that determines the development of the embryo

E. An organizer is a membrane protein that guides the migration of cells during embryonic development

F. An organizer is a physical structure that directs embryonic development

G. An organizer is a specialized region of the embryo that releases mechanical signals to shape organ formation

H. An organizer is a chemical secreted by certain cells in the embryo, which diffuses into and influences surrounding cells, playing a role in the development of tissues such as the nervous system and the limbs.

I. An organizer is a hormonal signal that triggers the maturation of certain embryonic tissues

J. An organizer is a cluster of maternal effect genes that control the early stages of embryogenesis
